publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7640 Bill Butler: The 40th Anniversary of the Ibrox Stadium Disaster—That the Parliament remembers the 66 football supporters who died in the Ibrox Stadium disaster on 2 January 1971; conveys its sincere condolences to the families and friends of those who lost their lives on that day; notes that a memorial service will be held to mark the 40th anniversary at the stadium on 3 January 2011 and that the former Rangers and Celtic captains, John Greig and Billy McNeill, will lead out the teams before the traditional New Year’s Old Firm game as a mark of respect, and looks forward to both clubs and their supporters putting sporting rivalries to one side and coming together to remember those who died that day.

S3M-7640 The 40th Anniversary of the Ibrox Stadium Disaster (lodged on 21 December 2010) Murdo Fraser*, Christine Grahame*, Kenneth Gibson*, Tricia Marwick*, Ross Finnie*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Jackson Carlaw*, James Kelly*, Nanette Milne*, Elizabeth Smith*, Jim Hume*, Richard Baker*, Marlyn Glen*, Patricia Ferguson*, Stewart Maxwell*, Elaine Smith*, Michael McMahon*, Hugh Henry*, Rob Gibson*, Karen Gillon*, Andrew Welsh*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Rhona Brankin*, Jamie McGrigor*, Mary Mulligan*, Jackie Baillie*, David Whitton*, Jim Tolson*, Bob Doris*, Des McNulty*, Cathy Jamieson*, Andy Kerr*, Helen Eadie*, Jamie Hepburn*, John Park*, Elaine Murray*, Liam McArthur*, Cathy Peattie*, Bill Kidd*, Sandra White*, Charlie Gordon*

S3M-7640 Bill Butler: The 40th Anniversary of the Ibrox Stadium Disaster—That the Parliament remembers the 66 football supporters who died in the Ibrox Stadium disaster on 2 January 1971; conveys its sincere condolences to the families and friends of those who lost their lives on that day; notes that a memorial service will be held to mark the 40th anniversary at the stadium on 3 January 2011 and that the former Rangers and Celtic captains, John Greig and Billy McNeill, will lead out the teams before the traditional New Year’s Old Firm game as a mark of respect, and looks forward to both clubs and their supporters putting sporting rivalries to one side and coming together to remember those who died that day. Supported by: Murdo Fraser, Christine Grahame, Kenneth Gibson, Tricia Marwick, Ross Finnie, Ms Wendy Alexander, Jackson Carlaw, James Kelly, Nanette Milne, Elizabeth Smith, Jim Hume, Richard Baker, Marlyn Glen, Patricia Ferguson, Stewart Maxwell, Elaine Smith, Michael McMahon, Hugh Henry, Rob Gibson, Karen Gillon, Andrew Welsh, Hugh O’Donnell, Rhona Brankin, Jamie McGrigor, Mary Mulligan, Jackie Baillie, David Whitton, Jim Tolson, Bob Doris, Des McNulty, Cathy Jamieson, Andy Kerr, Helen Eadie, Jamie Hepburn, John Park, Elaine Murray, Liam McArthur, Cathy Peattie, Bill Kidd, Sandra White, Charlie Gordon, Stuart McMillan*, Johann Lamont*, Jack McConnell*, Duncan McNeil*, Ken Macintosh*, Trish Godman*
S3M-7640 The 40th Anniversary of the Ibrox Stadium Disaster (lodged on 21 December 2010) Mr Frank McAveety*
S3M-7640 The 40th Anniversary of the Ibrox Stadium Disaster (lodged on 21 December 2010) Shirley-Anne Somerville*
S3M-7640 The 40th Anniversary of the Ibrox Stadium Disaster (lodged on 21 December 2010) Linda Fabiani*
